Package com.memoable.backend.controller

Class NoteController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.memoable.backend.controller.NoteController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/notes")
public class NoteController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for catching REST requests for getting, saving and deleting notes.
    Author:
    Jere Salmensaari

    • Method Detail

      • getUserNotes

        @GetMapping("/{id}")
public java.util.List<Note> getUserNotes​(@PathVariable
                                         java.lang.String id,
                                         @RequestHeader
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> headers)
        Gets user's notes from the database.

        Request must have a valid token matching to the given user ID in the headers as Bearer token to get the user's notes.

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the user whose notes should be returned.
        headers - Headers of the Http request.
        Returns:
        List of Notes beloging to the given user ID

      • save

        @PostMapping("save/{id}")
public Note save​(@RequestBody
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> body,
                 @RequestHeader
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> headers,
                 @PathVariable
                 java.lang.String id)
        Saves a new Note or if the Note's id already exists updates the original Note

        Must have a valid token mathcing to the user's id in the headers as a Bearer token.

        Parameters:
        body - Note body formatted as JSON.
        headers - Headers of the Http request.
        id - ID of the user whose note is going to be saved.
        Returns:
        Saved Note.

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping("delete/{id}/{note_id}")
public java.lang.Boolean delete​(@RequestHeader
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> headers,
                                @PathVariable
                                java.lang.String id,
                                @PathVariable
                                java.lang.String note_id)
        Deletes a note that mathces the given note_id

        Must have a valid token matching to the user's ID in the headers as a Bearer token.

        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of the Http request
        id - user's id whose note is going to be deleted
        note_id - id of the note to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if note can be deleted, otherwise false

      • parseJWT

        private java.lang.Boolean parseJWT​(java.lang.String token,
                                   java.lang.String id)
        Parses a JWT token and checks if the token's user matches the given id
        Parameters:
        token - JWT token to parse
        id - User id to compare the token to
        Returns:
        True if id's match, otherwise false
